Звуки Её Любви - судя по названию новеллы, можно подумать что это злостный хентай. Но нет, на самом деле вполне проходная романтика.

[h1]Сюжет.[/h1]
Очередной парень, в очередной элитной школе, влюбляется в очередную девушку. Бла, бла, бла. Читали такое сотню раз. Единственное отличие - парень не забитый зaдрот как это часто бывает в таких новеллах, а вполне нормальный школьник. А вот девушка наоборот социофобка. Сюжет в целом проходной, не раздражает, но и не радует.

[h1]Геймплей.[/h1]
Читаем текст, делаем выборы. Концовок 3 (считая плохую в середине новеллы). Развилок достаточное количество. Сама новелла относительно небольшая, и при хорошей скорости чтения, осиливается за пару часов.

[h1]Графика и звуки.[/h1]
Задники вполне обыкновенные для таких новелл. Девушка прорисована имхо не очень интересно, и с расчетом на любителей девушек с [strike]выменем[/strike] большим бюстом. Музыка имхо, так себе. Есть английская озвучка девушки, причем озвучивала её какая-то тихая, сонная муха, чтобы что-то расслышать надо сбавить громкость музыки при выкрученном голосе.

[h1]Как итог.[/h1]
Очередная история школьной любви. Без всякой пошлости, но и без всякого задора. Прочесть можно, но бывают новеллы и поинтереснее.
5 размер груди из 10.

36623499.review:
Sounds of Her Love... trzecia visual novel w jaką grałem i do tej pory zdecydowanie najlepsza.

 Ale może zacznijmy od początku: Sounds of Her Love jest visual novelą, która opowiada historię znajomości grającego z pewną dziewczyną ze szkoły - Ceridwen Erwood. Dziewczyna ta jest nieśmiałą osobą, która przed spotkaniem z nami nie miała żadnego przyjaciela. Ma też na głowie całą masę probelmów i zmartwień. W zależności od naszych wyborów albo:
[list]
 [*]zostaniemy razem w związku, [GOOD ENDING]
 [*]zostaniemy razem w związku na odległość, [NEUTRAL ENDING]
 [*]zachowamy się źle olewając dziewczynę kompletnie. [BAD ENDING]
[/list]
Historia ta w pewnych momentach była bardzo emocjonująca i wciągnęła mnie, ale w zupełnie inny sposób, niż robią to gry Sakura. Bo tak: Sakura Spirit wciągała mnie czasem na tyle, że zapominałem, iż gram w grę erotyczną ALE jest jedna ważna rzecz, która różni te dwie gry. W Sounds of Her Love nie ma ,,szczucia cycem''. Nie ma tutaj scenek erotycznych, nie ma praktycznie niczego nieodpowiedniego (no jedynie co, to w dwóch scenach widać majtki, ale w kontekście nie są nieodpowiednie). Ta historia wciąga, bo jest to przyjemna historia miłosna. I to, jako najważniejsza rzecz w visual novelach, wyszło świetnie!
 
Dobrze, to teraz przejdźmy do oprawy audiowizualnej. Zacznijmy od grafiki: bardzo podoba mi się sprite Ceri, wyszedł bardzo ładnie i z początku myślałem, że nie będę mógł się do niego przyzwyczaić, ale na szczęście to szybko minęło. Tła są ładne i dosyć szczegółowe. Jedyną rzeczą do jakiej mogę się przyczepić są niektóre scenki. A to tylko dlatego, że mają zupełnie inną kreskę. Same scenki są ładne, ale za bardzo odbiegają od kreski, którą widzimy całą grę. Gdyby sam sprite Ceri byłby w chociaż zbliżonej stylistyce to nie czepiał bym się, ale słabo jest widzieć obrazki, które są w sumie taką nagrodą, które tak mocno odbiegają stylem, że przyzwyczajeni już widząc ten uważamy go za o wiele gorszy. Co do muzyki, to zazwyczaj nie zwracam na ten aspekt zbyt dużej uwagi. Czasami powtarzał się jeden track, ale był na tyle długi i przyjemny, że mi to nie przeszkadzało. Jednak jak to często bywa sama ścieżka dźwiękowa jest dosyć bezpłciowa i nie zapada w pamięć. 
 
Ostatnią rzeczą, którą chcę podkreślić jest świetny voice acting Amber Barile, który sprawia, że postać Ceri nie jest tylko dobrze napisana, ale również dobrze zagrana. Z bólem serca przeklikiwałem BAD ENDING, bo bardzo łatwo było przywiązać się do Ceri. A przynajmniej ja mam takie odczucia. 
 
 Dobrze, więc podsumowując:

PLUSY: 
[list]
 [*]świetna historia
 [*]ładna oprawa graficzna
 [*]dopasowany dubbing
 [*]przyjemny soundtruck...
[/list]
MINUSY:
[list]
 [*]...który nie zapada w pamięć
 [*]niektóre obrazki za bardzo odbiegają od głównej oprawy graficznej (ale to kwestia gustu, więc tego minusa nie biorę pod uwagę przy werdykcie)

OCENA: 10/10

35114667.review:
[b]This is a very simple, but cute and enjoyable romantic VN[/b]. It's quite short (around 5 hours when you include exploring alternative choices) and doesn't offer any real plot twists or surprising moments, but focuses exclusively on the two main characters and their relationship. The heroine, Ceri, is pretty much your typical "shy girl" archetype, but is written and acted well enough to succesfully carry the game (she's the only character with a voice and sprites). [b]In the end, it should leave you with the warm feelings you expect from a story of this kind - its simplicity at least makes it relatable and not overly-contrived or reliant on pointless misunderstandings[/b].

The art and music are quite good, especially the sprites and backgrounds being visually pleasing and giving the whole experience quite a lot of charm. The style very much fits the timid and relaxing nature of the story, making it a really nice filler for a lazy afternoon. As a free game, it's really hard not to recommend it, although if you're not into romance it might simply bore you - there's really no twists to the formula here, simply a love story to make you happy when you need something like that.

34911331.review:
You get what you pay for, and then some. It's short, a little under 5 hours, if your a fast reader. That said, I'm not going to forget it quickly. 

The set up of the characters is enough to give them life. It gets a little... flowery, but that's normal considering the genre. 

Nothing really felt predictable, even though the subject matter is familiar enough to those who are into these sorts of games.

Aside from a single panty shot that made me feel more than a little uncomfortable given the context, there's nothing remotely explicit, so there's that.

It all felt very... true to life. The way people spoke, the story. The circumstances and dialogue choices never broke the suspension of disbelief for me at all. I never had to remind myself "Ah, this must be a moe thing" or "Hm, I recognize this trope from such and such anime style".

This game and it's title character are much the same: Subtle, softspoken, and simply adorable.

34897675.review:
[h1]Sounds of Her Love[/h1]

Sounds of Her Love ist wieder ein Visual Novel, was ich nun durchgelesen habe. Es ist eine Liebesgeschichte mit 3 Endings. Es gibt auch eine offizielle Anleitung des Weges, wobei er beim lesen klar erkennbar ist, was nun zum Bad Ending führt oder nicht. Man wird sehr gut ins Spiel eingebunden, wenn man seinen Namen eingeben kann und später auch seinen Geburtstag. Damit wird man halt auch direkt angesprochen. Spielzeit ist bei einem schnellen Leser bei circa 1,5 Std. Was ich sehr gut finde ist es recht einfaches Englisch ist. Es ist alles sehr leicht zu verstehen.

[b]Pro:[/b]
+ kostenlos
+ ziemlich guter Dub bei Ceri
+ leichtes Englisch
+ das miteinbinden des Spielers
+ tolle Geschichte und das für lau
+ 3 Endings (Gut, Neutral, Schlecht)
+ guter Soundtrack

[b]Contra:[/b]
- bei der Schluss Szene ist der letzte Satz viel zu laut (wenn Ihr etwas lauter spielt, stellt eure Boxen in der letzten Szene leiser)
- im Grunde hab ich nichts zu meckern, außer die nur 4 Bilder unter Gallery xD

[b]Fazit:[/b]
Ein tolles kostenloses Visual Novel, was mir sehr gut gefallen hat. Ich bin sehr negativ dagegen eingestellt, kostenlose Spiele schlecht zu bewerten, wenn diese mir nicht wirklich die Zeit rauben. Die Geschichte ist bezaubernd und die Entwickler hat sich die Mühe gemacht alles in einem leicht verständlichen Englisch auzubereiten. Dazu haben sie einen eigenen Guide für die Wege zu den einzelnen Endings erstellt. Diesen Visual Novel, kann ich bedenkenlos an jeden Anime, VN, Manga Fan empfehlen, die auch gerne mal romantische Sachen schauen oder lesen. Der Soundtrack stört kein bisschen und alles passt wirklich gut zusammen. Also wer hier sich sagt, kostenlose "Spiele" sind nie wirklich etwas, täuscht sich gewaltig.

34548138.review:
Though it wasn't very long, I enjoyed reading this visual novel very much. I played through the game and got all 3 endings. One happy ending, one neutral (bittersweet) ending, and one bad ending. The bad ending was very cruel... I only got it as a completionist. I felt like an absolute scumbag for even getting it, especially after completing the true ending.

I found the story to be very relatable (outside of the fact that the protagonist is half japanese lol). But the way the two main characters were written, it was absolutely believable. A loner meets an introvert in highschool. Through interacting with each other they begin developing a friendship, and possibly even find romance together.

Ceri is definitely a grade A waifu. Her voice actress, Amber Barile, definitely did a great job at portraying Ceri's introverted personality. Although I found that her volume was a little too low for the game. I had to turn the game's music quite low in order to her Ceri's voice lines. In any case, it's nice to see more visual novels with english voice overs. I hope to hear more from her, as well as many other voice actor for VNs!

But overall, I highly recommend this game to all visual novel and anime lovers. It's a little cheesy and stuff, but it's very cute. Those looking for a romance VN with a cute waifu, you don't have to look far! I even recommend this to anyone who is considering getting into visual novels. The game is free, so there's nothing to lose! 

I hope to see more work from the developer in the future!

34248157.review:
If you like romance visual novels, this one is overall okay. 

There were too many times I was getting bored and wanted a bit more character development to make it interesting. Since at one point you're just rushing through to get to the main character and Ceri's conversations. The VA for Ceri is lovely, but I do wish they had not written her character to be so timid all the time. It feels very stereotype. Then again, it is an anime visual novel and is also free, but it did rub me the wrong way a bit sometimes; it makes you question how you can fall in love with someone when you so barely get to know them. More expressions for Ceri would have been nice as well, since she didn't change very much, and when she did it was mostly between shy smiling to fearful/upset shock. Even a change of clothes for the one time occasion outside of school would have given her more personality. 

I would also like to mention that the still images of Ceri that are used in key moments are all a bit off in scale which makes the photos a bit odd after seeing a well proportioned image of her most of the game. I would recommend them making them all more consistent for the future. 

My only other complaint is that after investing all the time in this game to get to the end, I had hoped it would be longer and end with them farther along in their relationship. But again, it's free, so I suppose it's okay. Just felt kinda abrupt. 

2.5/4

32581450.review:
I want to preferace this review by stating I am not an avid fan of either visual novels or romance stories, and was trying something new when playing through this.

     I can't say that I'm disappointed I did however, as the story was engaging.  The main strength it has comes from the relationship and the fact that the chemistry between the player character and Ceri is genuinly believable.  It does a good job of putting you in the characters headspace as the loner highschool student and gets you to sympathize with this lonely introverted girl who's hiding emotional stress.  You get truly invested in getting close with her and helpping her through her troubled situation and seeing her through to a happy end.

     I can't give anything more than a light recommendation however, because while the relationship is a big strength, it is the novel's only strength.  Which isn't to say that everything else is bad, rather that everything else is there to serve its given purpous and nothing more.  The family isn't given much characterization beyond a few basic traits and don't play a very large role in the story other than to give arbitrary advice and at one point a contrived plot device.  (The father runs a publishing firm that just so happens to run with your girlfriend's favorite author)  I don't think the mother had any reason to be in the story at all, and as for characters outside the player's family they're all pretty much forgetable, only there to point the player from point A to B without much characterization given.

     The plot itself is also becomes predicitable by the end.  We start off with some mystery airing around Ceri and the issues that trouble her, but around the last third of the story things unwind in a way in which even I as a new comer to the gener could accurately predict what was going to happen.  This was not helpped at all by the fact that there are several late game dialouges that outright tell you what is going to happen, thereby sapping what little stakes were left in the story out completely.  There was real opportunity to drop something unexpected into the mix, a detail or plot development that would've changed things and increased the stakes a bit, but unfortunatly it was an opportunity that sorely missed.

     Since this is free however I still recommend the novel for its compeling romance and main characters, just don't go in expecting anything spectacular.

While rather short and simple when it comes to the story and choices, I still quite enjoyed the expirience. 

The visuals felt very warm and homey, as did the appropiate music to each scene. The story does feel rather short however, almost to sudden with certain aspects pertaining to the romance and other story aspects, but hey, its a slice-of-life feel good visual novel with a cute character and even cuter relationship. And real relationships can be just as random and unexpected.

One thing that surprised me in a good way was that despite how the story could've gone, and how the main character is styled, it never went raunchy or oversexualized anything. It was cute and safe all the way through, so big respects for that.

Now, my major complaint would have to be a few scenes with how Ceri was drawn. As an artist, I completely undertand how difficult it can be to draw certain proportions of a character, but there was 2 scenes (Not going to Spoil) that really threw me off from the game. Different parts of the character is drawn really disproportionatly, which is a bit distracting. However, this isn't to much a bother, as everything else is super cute no matter what. And the overall artstyle is just really cute.


Despite that. Cute Game. Cute Story. Cute Characters. 

A good short expirience that leaves warm fuzzy feelings in the heart.

32082272.review:
i don't really usually play visual novels, that much. (but i do enjoy story driven games).
and coming from a background, that is so different, to the cultures that this game is set on, there are many things that are unnacceptable.

but, i must say, regardless of that, the game, and story was actually good enough, to keep someone like me, despite these 2 issues, engaged enough in it, to actually do all three endings (it might not show on my play time of the game, because i was playing it in offline mode, so, only few minutes were regiestered). 

as somehow, despite this major difference, i was still able to project myself and see myself into the player character, through his choices, words and other moments into the game. which is a major Win in the writing area of the game.

the writing was amazing, everything simply blended well togather. i loved the branching, and branches in it. 
the music and the voice acting was spot on too. (if yo lower the music a bit). 

last words{before the part that contains spoilers}, do i recommend this game? absolutely, a very well done, well written, well made, coherant visual novel. 
that, even people who don't play visual novels, may find something in it. {even if they're from a vastly different culture, where a lot of things would be totally unacceptable, and would never happen/be done}.
was a nice game, and a nice fantasy, great job for the developers. 

the game could, and can be much more, but, looking at how, it is an extremely low budget visual novel, and how it is literally a free game, i can let that pass. so im more than forgiving for the music, and the fact that, there is one character sprite and other low budget things.
i can see, that, during development, the developers probably had much more to offer, but for it being a very low budget project {i can totally see that in the game}, i can understand, and feel like, that , they had to chip away, at a LOT of things, including writing, and story parts.


*spoiler alert*
[spoiler] after completing all three branches, i must say, the good ending really is good, it is satisfying, but i can't help but feel some minor changes would make it a lot better, but other than that, the ending, really is good, and is just, very satisfying. and heart warming. (i loved the plays on the name of the game honestly, how it changes through the endings).

next for the bad ending route, i must say, it is not really bad, its just, the player character being totally and absolutely, socially awkward to high amounts, which happens to some people that is for sure, i wouldn't really call it a bad ending, it is just that, the player choices make him so awkward, that the story literally gets forced into an ending. 

finally, for the  ending that i found actually to be the worst(story/player character actions/reactions wise), and far more painful, than the bad ending, this route, is just, plain half heartedness, which is something i really dislike, that is the first point, but out side of what i like and hate, the choices that the player character seems to do, based on your decisions while on this route, are just, not spot on, and not satisfying at all, even to a point where they feel and make me say "no i know i did these decisions to end up here, but i feel that, there is still much more that can be done" but instead what happens is that, he sits in his place for 4-5 days, and then, in its epilouge, they call each other, and the ending was just the worst, absolute half heartedness, he realized his feelings, and made them seem like such a big deal, and like "very in love" but then treating these emotions as medicore, through self defeating dialouges and just generally negative thoughts the player is forced to read, that can very well be replaced with things way better, it was honestly, just halfheartedness, plain cowardance, and waiting for "fate" to solve itself for you, instead of you solving it. 
leaving you at the end of the story asking "what was the point?"

of course, not to say, that, this route doesn't have its place in the game, some people maybe able to find these reactions that the player make when in this route, to be reasonable, but as i said, they just don't sit well with me, and almost feel like, they are illogical, and just plain teenage cowardance of facing reality path, i do realize they're teenagers, but, i'm a teenager myself, and just watching such things, is honestly, not fun at all. {excluding the fact again, that, this ending, is even more painful than the bad ending, for other reasons, over all, this is the most painful route, and the worst route in writing.}  [/spoiler]

31565471.review:
In [i]Sounds of Her Love[/i], you play as a half-Japanese, half-English student attending an "international school" in Japan. There you meet fellow student Ceridwan "Ceri" Erwood, a very shy girl and an avid reader. You become curious about her and start spending more time around her as a friendship begins to develop.

This game is a visual novel, a type of video game entirely story-driven. Most of the game is reading the story, though there are a few decision points along the way that ultimately decide the course of the story. There are three different endings to achieve.

Overall, I felt this game was weak in several regards. Starting with the art, there is only one character sprite in the game, that of Ceri. Despite the presence of a few other important characters, such as the protagonist's parents and Ceri's father, no one else makes an actual physical appearance. Ceri also gets a voice actor in this game, in English, which is a bit different for a visual novel. However, I felt the acting often came off as very wooden and stilted.

The main problem of this visual novel is the writing. What we have here is a very shallow romance plot. Even though I clocked-in around two-and-a-half hours in this game, it felt like almost nothing happened. There was hardly any conflict or interesting or memorable points in the story. It just felt like some dialogue scenes with barely a plot to speak of. The pacing of the story is also poor. The entire story takes place over less than two weeks which makes the events seem ridiculously rushed. There was never much of a chance to develop the characters very much and I never cared about any of them. I must also especially fault the Ceri character. She is as cliché as they come being written as a standard cute, but shy, girl (complete with large breasts) that has trouble making friends for vague reasons and it is up to you, the player, to act as her white knight. It all just struck me as a terribly unoriginal story that was never interesting.

I find myself not recommending this visual novel. The writing and characterization is shallow, boring, and unoriginal. It is free so if you are really curious and like visual novels you do not have much to lose, but others can pass.

This is a nice little story. There are three endings. Bad, where the relationship does not progress, Neutral, where... something interrupts the relationship (but there is a sliver of hope for the future), and good, where everything works out.

You play a boy who has been transferred into a "Welsh" school in Tokyo, because your mother wants you to experience your "Anglican" roots... in other words, neither your mother or father checked for an "English" school... You meet a young lady named Ceridwen (Ceri; K sound), who is a warm-hearted bookworm... and who has gone through some bullying in the past... and there are issues she has yet to face fully. A relationship can blossom. Will it lead to love?

30914367.review:
Okay, so how do I start this off...            

Since video games and reading romantic (and Adventure) novels are some of the things I enjoy, this was an interesting "Playthrough" for me. While this is only a visual novel you are given some choice throughout your gameplay, not too much but enough to affect the entire ending of the game. To give info on how easy the choices are, I, without knowing the outcome of my choices, recieved the best ending based on logic of relationships. So as long if you have basic psychology skills and pure common sense you should be fine getting through these decisions.

Getting into depth with the story, here's a quick review. I was pretty neutral about the start of the story, as it seemed to start off like a typical "Girl drops something, guy helps, Girl becomes flushed in appearance" sort of way. a bit after the start of the story (roughly 15 minutes in) choices become really logical as stated before and your character's decisions and dialogue stay rational. The story stays like this for sometime, with numerous yet slight differentials in story mechanics. However, the novel really starts to become riveting at the climax.

* I'm going to spoil some of the story here so DON'T put your cursor near the review while reading this *

[spoiler] As you are up in Ceri's room she explains her life in the past 2 years. while she talks she informs the player about her being bullied by people due to self confidence issues, divorce between her Mother and Father, and being taken out of school because of her being bullied in school. She also goes on to explain how the player gave her a chance at being social again and both Ceri and the player are important they are in each other's lives.

This event of solace and commending is short lived because soon after the player notified by the father that Ceri's mother, who lives with her ex in Wales, is trying to regain custody of Ceri. [/spoiler]

I honestly thought the overall story was adorable, while it could use a bit of patching up in some places. For some reason Ceri's own life and decisions reminded me of my own life somehow, most likely because I had to move twice (from around the Southfield area to Kalamazoo and then back in the span of 2 years) and I would fake my own illness to stop going to school to prevent me from seeing this one group of people than would always tantalize me throughout elementary and the start of middle school. I would also fake illness to prevent going places where there were a lot of people. This was basically the borderline of social anxiety that I had thoughout my early life, 	[spoiler] along with bipolar disorder...	 (I had a rough childhood [although video games, drawing, and music mainly helped] ) [/spoiler].

In the end, your reading a great visual novel and getting (basic) social advice by readin this, so you should probably get this visual novel before it becomes a pay2read.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The (True) Bad ending was messed up though

30823336.review:
(It says I don't have much time but I have fully completed the game)

The game is nice for a free visual novel, there is good music and the sprite for the main girl is good (despite her being the only sprite), but some of the art work varies and it is inconsistent. It's good for the fact that the girl is unique which is nice, but the story is cliche which is kind of boring. The main conflict isn't really a conflict in the end. There is only one voice actor, which is really awkward for the game. There are a lot of cons to this game, but it isn't too long so you can still pick it up and play it so it's not too bad. The only thing keeping this a positive review is the fact that it's free.

30763161.review:
I'll be honest. When I read the description for this VN I wasn't really that impressed. It seemed like your normal slice of life VN with a bored male MC who sudenly meets a girl then bam! there's your story. Not something that will make you want to play it imidiately but The artwork pulled me in and the fact that is was free and rather short gave me motivation to give it a shot because why not?

Well, I played it, and well, it's is a slice of life VN, it does involve a MC who meets a girl which is the story. But their story, their interactions was charming and sweet, so i'm glad I gave it a shot. 

The Namable MC here is a quite likable, Ceri herself is a sweet character going through an ordeal. Their interactions seemed natural, I also liked their respective families, It's only a shame they don't have any sprites. Not to mention the artwork is nice, the interface is also well polished.

It is a nice game, it's short, simple but touching and also it's free! If you want to read a story about 2 people learning to depend on each other that will tug your heartstrings a bit then this is a good game to try.

30421350.review:
-Minor spelling mistakes; chilren, etc
-Voice Volume to background music needs level adjustments. The voice compared to BGM is very low.
-Moeblob MC, she's cute, but still in need of some deeper development and complication
-Shortsighted =/= nearsighted

Other than those few mistakes, it was an enjoyable, quick, cute story. MC is less of a douchebag than most, and I would love to have Ceri's dad as my Father-in-Law; Dude knows what's up. 

A fun first attempt, and worthy of a play. I'd suggest easing up on the heart-strings and stutters a bit however. It's cute at first, then it just gets a b-b-b- bit mu-m-m-much.
